definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Monasteries originally developed in the Middle East and Greece form the hermits'buts.
sentences.chinese: 修道院的前身是中東和希臘的隱士隱居的茅舍。
隱士舉手合十在他的額頂。

sentences.english: Yet, to think of her as a friendless hermit would be incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我們並不能把她看作是沒有朋友的隱士。

sentences.english: Brown recluse spider bites can often look like the common bull's-eye.
sentences.chinese: 棕色隱士蜘蛛咬傷通常可以像常見的靶心。

sentences.english: A hermit is said to have practiced alchemy here .
sentences.chinese: 據說有位隱士曾在此煉丹。

sentences.english: The very word austerity has been spoilt by the monks, by the sannyasis, by the hermits.
sentences.chinese: 簡樸這個詞被僧侶們，遁世者，隱士們，破壞了。

sentences.english: You know what I am a bit of an anchorite.
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎？我現在就是有點隱士。

sentences.english: On his lonely estate Eugene lived the life of an anchorite .
sentences.chinese: 葉甫蓋尼在寂寞冷清的莊園裏過着隱士般的生活。

sentences.english: All four bade an affectionate farewell to the Hermit and promised that they would soon visit him again.
sentences.chinese: 四個人馬一齊跟隱士依依告別，答應不久再來拜望他。

sentences.english: The mystics and hermits of T'ien Ch'i have always benn obsessed with longevity.
sentences.chinese: 天啓王朝的隱士和修道者們熱衷於研習長壽的祕密。

sentences.english: If I was a hermit, I could certainly manage with a single pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 倘若我是一位隱士，我完全可以用一雙鞋子湊乎過去。

sentences.english: Recluse culture is the cultural complex, which is reflected and spread by the recluses as carriers.
sentences.chinese: 隱逸文化是以隱士爲載體來反映和傳播的文化複合體。

sentences.english: She was one of American literature's most reclusive figures.
sentences.chinese: 她是美國文學史上著名的隱士。

sentences.english: He became a hermit after he was dismissed from office.
The hermit invariably shuddered when he looked out of his window.
sentences.chinese: 隱士向窗外望去，一如以往地打了個寒顫。

sentences.english: Reclusive groups flourished during the early Ming period.
sentences.chinese: 元明之際存在着大量不樂仕進的隱士羣體。

definition: to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
Tao Yuanming (c. 365-427), Jin dynasty writer and poet
to practice Chan Buddhist meditation/to practice Zen meditation/to sit in meditation
Xie Lingyun (385-433) poet during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
